description: [ISS] Globally and in Africa, many electoral processes suffer from a lack of transparency, trust and oversight.
title: Africa: Five Worrying Signs of Africa's Poor Election Quality

description: [African Union] Africa is the only continent endowed with natural ingredients that can easily be used to greatly expand agricultural production. Africa has 60 percent of the world's available arable land, the largest share globally, and suitable for agricultural production expansion, and abundant untapped water resources. Agriculture is the source of livelihood for 70 percent of the population on the continent. The African Union Comprehensive Africa Agriculture Development Program (CAADP) adopted in 2003, is Africa's
title: Africa: Unlocking the Potential of Africa's Soils for a Food Secure Continent

description: [DA] After more than a hundred years of operation in South Africa, the international energy conglomerate Shell Plc is the latest major company to confirm that it plans to divest from our country due to the inhospitable environment fostered by the ANC government.
title: Africa: South Africa Has Become Uninvestable Under ANC Rule

description: [WHO-AFRO] Windhoek -- The World Health Organization (WHO) Regional Office for Africa and partner organizations today launched the region's first-ever health investment charter that aims to align and drive sustainable investment in the health workforce.
title: Africa: African Region's First-Ever Health Workforce Investment Charter Launched

description: [UNDP] The way we communicate the issue has a different impact on different audiences
title: Africa: Are We Communicating Climate Change Wrong? Here Are Five Ways to Improve

description: [New Times] Mogadishu -- A high-level delegation from the African Union Commission has wrapped up their assessment visit to Somalia by vowing to preserve the hard-won stabilization gains achieved so far, ahead of the exit of the AU peacekeeping troops.
title: Africa: AU Vows to Safeguard Security Gains in Somalia Ahead of Troop Exit

description: [Independent (Kampala)] As unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) become increasingly critical for modern armed forces, African countries are investing in the local production of military drones.
title: Africa: Arms Race - Made-in-Africa Military Drones On the Rise

description: [Global Fund] Windhoek -- The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria (the Global Fund), warmly welcomes the launch of the Africa Health Workforce Investment Charter, which was signed today in Windhoek, Namibia, at the Africa Health Workforce Investment Forum.
title: Africa: Global Fund Hails Launch of Africa Health Workforce Investment Charter

description: [Afropop] It's been a busy year, and we've fallen a bit behind in posting the most awesome new Afropop videos we've come across. So today we have nine new offerings for you. We start with the latest from Mali's Amadou &amp; Mariam and proceed with Tuareg rock, Afro-house from the Caribbean, all-female Brazilian Afrobeat, a playful red state nudge from Willie Nelson and Orville Peck and much more. Check out the full Afropop Top Videos playlist for all our recent selections. And remember, if you have suggestions of
title: Africa: Afropop Top Videos - Amadou &amp; Mariam, Mdou Moctar, Noise Cans, Malika Zarra, Meridian Brothers and More...

description: [Africa CDC] Honorables and dear colleagues, please let me first thank the Government of Namibia for hosting this Forum and welcoming us.
title: Africa: Opening Remarks By H.E. Dr. Jean Kaseya At the Launching of the Africa Health Workforce Investment Charter

description: [African Arguments] When malaria rages, the women whose labour, visible and invisible, is the bedrock of the care economy, suffer; the effects reverberate across society.
title: Africa: Malaria Is a Women's Rights Issue

description: [Leadership] Media owners, chief executives, editors and other categories of journalists will be converging on Nairobi, Kenya for the biggest AllAfrica Media Leaders' Summit (AMLS).
title: Africa: Kenya Hosts Biggest Africa Media Summit Tuesday
